content: Norway's capital Christiania was renamed [Oslo](/wiki/Oslo "Oslo").
sources: Mercer, Derrik (1989). *Chronicle of the 20th Century*. London: Chronicle Communications Ltd. p. 326. [ISBN](/wiki/ISBN_(identifier) "ISBN (identifier)") [978-0-582-03919-3](/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-582-03919-3 "Special:BookSources/978-0-582-03919-3").

content: In the [11th Rose Bowl](/wiki/1925_Rose_Bowl "1925 Rose Bowl"), the [Notre Dame Fighting Irish](/wiki/Notre_Dame_Fighting_Irish "Notre Dame Fighting Irish") beat [Stanford University](/wiki/Stanford_University "Stanford University"), 27 to 10.

A small contingent of [U.S. Marines](/wiki/United_States_Marine_Corps "United States Marine Corps") arrived at [Nanjing](/wiki/Nanjing "Nanjing") to patrol the vicinity of the [university](/wiki/Nanjing_University "Nanjing University") and protect Americans there from further looting.
sources: "Marines Guard U.S. College in Nanking, China". *[Chicago Daily Tribune](/wiki/Chicago_Daily_Tribune "Chicago Daily Tribune")*. January 3, 1925. p. 1.

content: [Costa Rica](/wiki/Costa_Rica "Costa Rica") decided to withdraw from the [League of Nations](/wiki/League_of_Nations "League of Nations") over the League's failure to address regional disputes.
sources: ["Chronology 1925"](https://web.archive.org/web/20200402163002/http://www.indiana.edu/~league/1925.htm). *indiana.edu*. 2002. Archived from [the original](http://www.indiana.edu/~league/1925.htm) on April 2, 2020. Retrieved January 2, 2015.

content: The states of [Aleppo](/wiki/Aleppo "Aleppo") and [Damascus](/wiki/Damascus "Damascus") were united into the [State of Syria](/wiki/State_of_Syria_(1924-30) "State of Syria (1924-30)").
sources: ["Chronology 1925"](https://web.archive.org/web/20200402163002/http://www.indiana.edu/~league/1925.htm). *indiana.edu*. 2002. Archived from [the original](http://www.indiana.edu/~league/1925.htm) on April 2, 2020. Retrieved January 2, 2015.

content: **Born:** [Paul Bomani](/wiki/Paul_Bomani "Paul Bomani"), politician and ambassador, in [Musoma](/wiki/Musoma "Musoma"), [Tanzania](/wiki/Tanzania "Tanzania") (d. 2005)

Fresh violence broke out around Italy as [Benito Mussolini](/wiki/Benito_Mussolini "Benito Mussolini")'s crackdown on opposition newspapers continued. Fascists seized or attacked newspaper presses while at least three were killed in rioting. Mussolini met with King [Victor Emmanuel III](/wiki/Victor_Emmanuel_III_of_Italy "Victor Emmanuel III of Italy") and requested dictatorial powers to quell the chaos. The king refused, but gave Mussolini tacit permission to act however he considered necessary within at least the appearance of constitutional legality.
sources: "Italian Riots Defy Iron Fist of Mussolini". *[Chicago Daily Tribune](/wiki/Chicago_Daily_Tribune "Chicago Daily Tribune")*. January 3, 1925. p. 2.

Sullivan, Brian R. (2014). *My Fault: Mussolini as I Knew Him*. New York: Enigma Books. p. 113. [ISBN](/wiki/ISBN_(identifier) "ISBN (identifier)") [978-1-936274-39-0](/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-1-936274-39-0 "Special:BookSources/978-1-936274-39-0").

content: [Leo Chiozza Money](/wiki/Leo_Chiozza_Money "Leo Chiozza Money") testified before Britain's [Royal Commission](/wiki/Royal_Commission "Royal Commission") that an increase in the world's population had led to the country's food situation becoming as desperate as it was during the [war](/wiki/World_War_I "World War I"). "The 10 pence price of bread has doubled in recent years and looking into the future there are good prospects of its doubling again", he stated. Money recommended a "department of supply" be created to remedy the problem.
sources: "Food Situation in Britain Bad as During War". *[Chicago Daily Tribune](/wiki/Chicago_Daily_Tribune "Chicago Daily Tribune")*. January 3, 1925. p. 3.

content: **Born:** [Giacomo Furia](/wiki/Giacomo_Furia "Giacomo Furia"), actor, in [Naples](/wiki/Naples "Naples"), Italy (d. 2015); [Larry Harmon](/wiki/Larry_Harmon "Larry Harmon"), entertainer ([Bozo the Clown](/wiki/Bozo_the_Clown "Bozo the Clown")), in [Toledo, Ohio](/wiki/Toledo,_Ohio "Toledo, Ohio") (d. 2008); [Eraño de Guzman Manalo](/wiki/Era%C3%B1o_Manalo "Eraño Manalo"), 2nd Executive Minister (*Tagapamahalang Pangkalahatan*) of the *[Iglesia ni Cristo](/wiki/Iglesia_ni_Cristo "Iglesia ni Cristo")* (Church of Christ), in [San Juan City](/wiki/San_Juan,_Metro_Manila "San Juan, Metro Manila"), [Philippines](/wiki/Philippines "Philippines") (d. 2009)
**Died:** [Nikola Petroff](/wiki/Nikola_Petroff "Nikola Petroff"), 51, Bulgarian wrestler

[Benito Mussolini](/wiki/Benito_Mussolini "Benito Mussolini") made a pivotal speech in the Italian [Chamber of Deputies](/wiki/Chamber_of_Deputies_(Italy) "Chamber of Deputies (Italy)"). He took personal responsibility for the actions of his [Blackshirts](/wiki/Milizia_Volontaria_per_la_Sicurezza_Nazionale "Milizia Volontaria per la Sicurezza Nazionale"), challenged his political opponents to remove him from office and then promised to take charge of restoring order to Italy within forty-eight hours. Historians now trace this speech to the beginning of Mussolini's dictatorship.
sources: Pugliese, Stanislao G., ed. (2004). *Fascism, Anti-fascism, and the Resistance in Italy: 1919 to the Present*. Rowman & Littlefield Publishers, Inc. p. 69. [ISBN](/wiki/ISBN_(identifier) "ISBN (identifier)") [0-7425-3123-6](/wiki/Special:BookSources/0-7425-3123-6 "Special:BookSources/0-7425-3123-6").

Dell'Orto, Giovanna (2013). *American Journalism and International Relations*. Cambridge University Press. p. 90. [ISBN](/wiki/ISBN_(identifier) "ISBN (identifier)") [978-1-107-03195-1](/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-1-107-03195-1 "Special:BookSources/978-1-107-03195-1").

content: [Cyril Brownlie](/wiki/Cyril_Brownlie "Cyril Brownlie") was sent off the field for foul play during a rough Test match against England during New Zealand's [1924–25 rugby union tour](/wiki/1924%E2%80%9325_New_Zealand_rugby_union_tour_of_Britain,_Ireland_and_France "1924–25 New Zealand rugby union tour of Britain, Ireland and France") of Britain, Ireland and France. It was the first time such a severe sanction had ever been applied in an international rugby match. New Zealand won 17-11.
sources: Mercer, Derrik (1989). *Chronicle of the 20th Century*. London: Chronicle Communications Ltd. p. 326. [ISBN](/wiki/ISBN_(identifier) "ISBN (identifier)") [978-0-582-03919-3](/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-582-03919-3 "Special:BookSources/978-0-582-03919-3").

content: Prefects throughout Italy received orders to control all "suspect" political organizations. Over the next two days, hundreds of private homes were searched, meeting halls were closed, political groups were disbanded and newspapers were seized.
sources: Murray, Lorraine, ed. (2014). *Italy*. [Encyclopædia Britannica, Inc.](/wiki/Encyclop%C3%A6dia_Britannica "Encyclopædia Britannica") p. 245. [ISBN](/wiki/ISBN_(identifier) "ISBN (identifier)") [978-1-61530-989-4](/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-1-61530-989-4 "Special:BookSources/978-1-61530-989-4").

Mercer, Derrik (1989). *Chronicle of the 20th Century*. London: Chronicle Communications Ltd. p. 326. [ISBN](/wiki/ISBN_(identifier) "ISBN (identifier)") [978-0-582-03919-3](/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-582-03919-3 "Special:BookSources/978-0-582-03919-3").
Clayton, John (January 7, 1925). "Italy Subdued by Fascist Leash of Mussolini". *[Chicago Daily Tribune](/wiki/Chicago_Daily_Tribune "Chicago Daily Tribune")*. p. 13.

content: [Adolf Hitler](/wiki/Adolf_Hitler "Adolf Hitler"), whose [Nazi Party](/wiki/Nazi_Party "Nazi Party") had been banned in [Bavaria](/wiki/Bavaria "Bavaria") since the failed [Beer Hall Putsch](/wiki/Beer_Hall_Putsch "Beer Hall Putsch"), met with the state's [Minister President](/wiki/Minister-President "Minister-President") [Heinrich Held](/wiki/Heinrich_Held "Heinrich Held"). Hitler pledged total loyalty to Held and offered to help him in his fight against communists.[*[self-published source](/wiki/Wikipedia:Verifiability#Self-published_sources "Wikipedia:Verifiability")*]
sources: Tague, James E. (2011). *The Last Field Marshal*. Xlibris Corporation. p. 50. [ISBN](/wiki/ISBN_(identifier) "ISBN (identifier)") [978-1-4568-3185-1](/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-1-4568-3185-1 "Special:BookSources/978-1-4568-3185-1").

content: **Born:** [Veikko Hakulinen](/wiki/Veikko_Hakulinen "Veikko Hakulinen"), cross-country skier, in [Kurkijoki](/wiki/Lakhdenpokhsky_District "Lakhdenpokhsky District"), [Karelian ASSR](/wiki/Karelian_Autonomous_Soviet_Socialist_Republic "Karelian Autonomous Soviet Socialist Republic") (d. 2003)
**Died:** [Nellie Cashman](/wiki/Nellie_Cashman "Nellie Cashman"), 79 or 80, Irish-born prospector

The two ministers from the [Liberal Party](/wiki/Italian_Liberal_Party "Italian Liberal Party") in Mussolini's cabinet, Gino Sarrocchi and Alessandro Casati, turned in their resignations. They were to be replaced by loyal [Fascists](/wiki/National_Fascist_Party "National Fascist Party"), who were now the only party in Mussolini's Cabinet.
sources: "Mussolini Supreme in New Crisis". *Franklin News-Herald*. Franklin, Pennsylvania. January 5, 1925. p. 1.
"Bayonets Give Mussolini Full Power in Italy". *[Chicago Daily Tribune](/wiki/Chicago_Daily_Tribune "Chicago Daily Tribune")*: 1. January 6, 1925.

content: [Nellie Tayloe Ross](/wiki/Nellie_Tayloe_Ross "Nellie Tayloe Ross") of [Wyoming](/wiki/Wyoming "Wyoming") became the first female governor in United States History.

At the Finnish-American A.C. Games held at [Madison Square Garden](/wiki/Madison_Square_Garden_(1890) "Madison Square Garden (1890)"), Finnish runner [Paavo Nurmi](/wiki/Paavo_Nurmi "Paavo Nurmi") set two new indoor records in front of a standing-room only crowd.
sources: ["Madison Square Garden III"](http://hockey.ballparks.com/NHL/NewYorkRangers/3rdoldindex.htm). *Ballparks.com*. Munsey & Suppes. Retrieved January 2, 2015.

["Jan. 6, 1925: Nurmi Breaks Two World Records"](http://www.history.com/this-day-in-history/nurmi-breaks-two-world-records). *This Day in History*. [A&E Networks](/wiki/A%26E_Networks "A&E Networks").

content: The German cruiser [*Emden*](/wiki/German_cruiser_Emden "German cruiser Emden") was launched, the first large warship built in Germany since the end of the [war](/wiki/World_War_I "World War I").
**Born:** [John DeLorean](/wiki/John_DeLorean "John DeLorean"), car maker, in [Detroit](/wiki/Detroit "Detroit") (d. 2005)
The new [Al Jolson](/wiki/Al_Jolson "Al Jolson") stage show *Big Boy* opened at the [Winter Garden Theatre](/wiki/Winter_Garden_Theatre "Winter Garden Theatre") on Broadway.
sources: ["The Immortal Al Jolson"](http://www.museumoffamilyhistory.com/ajolson-onstage.htm). *The Museum of Family History*. 2008. Retrieved January 2, 2015.

content: **Born:** [Gerald Durrell](/wiki/Gerald_Durrell "Gerald Durrell"), English naturalist, zookeeper, author, and television presenter, in [Jamshedpur](/wiki/Jamshedpur "Jamshedpur"), [British India](/wiki/British_Raj "British Raj") (d. 1995)

A joint manifesto signed by the leaders of the parties "on the [Aventine](/wiki/Aventine_Secession_(20th_century) "Aventine Secession (20th century)")" condemned Mussolini's suppression of dissent, writing, "The whole country can bear witness to the fact that the pretext of this policy is a ridiculous lie as no conspiracy is threatening the country and no attempt has been made against the laws." The manifesto suggested that Mussolini resign.
sources: Clayton, John (January 9, 1925). "Opposition in Bitter Attack on Mussolini". *[Chicago Daily Tribune](/wiki/Chicago_Daily_Tribune "Chicago Daily Tribune")*. p. 4.

content: **Born:** [Helmuth Hübener](/wiki/Helmuth_H%C3%BCbener "Helmuth Hübener"), anti-Nazi youth activist, in [Hamburg](/wiki/Hamburg "Hamburg"), Germany (d. 1942)
**Died:** [George Bellows](/wiki/George_Bellows "George Bellows"), 42, American artist

British economist [George Paish](/wiki/George_Paish "George Paish") said that another war in Europe was inevitable unless Germany's [reparations payments](/wiki/World_War_I_reparations "World War I reparations") were reduced and the French were to leave the [Rhineland](/wiki/Occupation_of_the_Rhineland "Occupation of the Rhineland"). He also warned that "Germany will not make the mistake she made the last time, in having Russia as an enemy, but will have that nation as a friend. Germany and Russia will be able to overrun Europe and establish a military despotism."
sources: "Briton Sees New War Unless French Evacuate Rhineland". *[Chicago Daily Tribune](/wiki/Chicago_Daily_Tribune "Chicago Daily Tribune")*. January 10, 1925. p. 3.

content: **Born:** [Lee Van Cleef](/wiki/Lee_Van_Cleef "Lee Van Cleef"), film actor, in [Somerville, New Jersey](/wiki/Somerville,_New_Jersey "Somerville, New Jersey") (d. 1989)

The [Ku Klux Klan](/wiki/Ku_Klux_Klan "Ku Klux Klan") was banned from the state of [Kansas](/wiki/Kansas "Kansas") when its [Supreme Court](/wiki/Kansas_Supreme_Court "Kansas Supreme Court") ruled that it was a corporation organized for profit and therefore could not operate there without a [charter](/wiki/Charter "Charter").
sources: "Klan Kicked Out of Kansas Home by State Courts". *[Chicago Daily Tribune](/wiki/Chicago_Daily_Tribune "Chicago Daily Tribune")*. January 11, 1925. p. 3.

content: [Beijing](/wiki/Beijing "Beijing") was seized by the combined forces of [Sun Chuanfang](/wiki/Sun_Chuanfang "Sun Chuanfang") and Qi Xieyuan.
sources: Mercer, Derrik (1989). *Chronicle of the 20th Century*. London: Chronicle Communications Ltd. p. 326. [ISBN](/wiki/ISBN_(identifier) "ISBN (identifier)") [978-0-582-03919-3](/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-582-03919-3 "Special:BookSources/978-0-582-03919-3").

content: The [Chinese Communist Party](/wiki/Chinese_Communist_Party "Chinese Communist Party") opened its [Fourth Congress](/wiki/National_Congress_of_the_Chinese_Communist_Party "National Congress of the Chinese Communist Party") in [Shanghai](/wiki/Shanghai "Shanghai").
**Born:** [Grant Tinker](/wiki/Grant_Tinker "Grant Tinker"), television executive, in [Stamford, Connecticut](/wiki/Stamford,_Connecticut "Stamford, Connecticut") (d. 2016)

In [Chicago](/wiki/Chicago "Chicago"), the [North Side Gang](/wiki/North_Side_Gang "North Side Gang") tried to kill [Al Capone](/wiki/Al_Capone "Al Capone"), using [Tommy guns](/wiki/Thompson_submachine_gun "Thompson submachine gun") to rake his car with bullets as it idled outside a [State Street](/wiki/State_Street_(Chicago) "State Street (Chicago)") restaurant. Only Capone's bodyguard was wounded as Capone himself was doing business inside, but the attack prompted him to order Tommy guns for his own men, as well as his famous bulletproof [Cadillac](/wiki/Cadillac "Cadillac").
sources: Hendley, Nate (2010). *Al Capone: Chicago's King of Crime*. Five Rivers Chapmanry. [ISBN](/wiki/ISBN_(identifier) "ISBN (identifier)") [978-0-9865427-2-5](/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-9865427-2-5 "Special:BookSources/978-0-9865427-2-5").
May, Allan (1999). ["Whacked By the Good Guys"](http://allanrmay.com/Vincent_Drucci.html). *Allan R. May*. Retrieved January 2, 2015.

content: The [John Howard Lawson](/wiki/John_Howard_Lawson "John Howard Lawson") play *[Processional: A Jazz Symphony of American Life](/wiki/Processional_(play) "Processional (play)")* opened at the [Garrick Theatre](/wiki/Garrick_Theatre_(New_York) "Garrick Theatre (New York)") in New York.
25 were killed and 60 injured in a train crash in [Westphalia](/wiki/Westphalia "Westphalia"), Germany.
sources: Mercer, Derrik (1989). *Chronicle of the 20th Century*. London: Chronicle Communications Ltd. p. 326. [ISBN](/wiki/ISBN_(identifier) "ISBN (identifier)") [978-0-582-03919-3](/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-582-03919-3 "Special:BookSources/978-0-582-03919-3").

content: **Born:** [Georgi Kaloyanchev](/wiki/Georgi_Kaloyanchev "Georgi Kaloyanchev"), actor, in [Burgas](/wiki/Burgas "Burgas"), [Bulgaria](/wiki/Bulgaria "Bulgaria") (d. 2012); [Gwen Verdon](/wiki/Gwen_Verdon "Gwen Verdon"), actress and dancer, in [Culver City, California](/wiki/Culver_City,_California "Culver City, California") (d. 2000)

The Agreement Regarding the Distribution of the Dawes Annuities was signed in Paris among the [Entente Powers](/wiki/Allies_of_World_War_I "Allies of World War I"), apportioning the distribution of the [Central Powers](/wiki/Central_Powers "Central Powers")' [reparations](/wiki/World_War_I_reparations "World War I reparations") payments, including those of Germany under the [Dawes Plan](/wiki/Dawes_Plan "Dawes Plan"), among the various countries that were entitled to the payments.
sources: ["The Commission for Relief in Belgium"](http://net.lib.byu.edu/estu/wwi/comment/CRB/CRB2-14.htm). *Public Relations of the Commission for Relief in Belgium*. Gay & Fisher. Retrieved January 2, 2015.

Bevans, Charles Irving (1969). *Treaties and Other International Agreements of the United States of America, 1776–1949, Volume 2*. [United States Department of State](/wiki/United_States_Department_of_State "United States Department of State"). pp. 504–505.

content: **Born:** [Yukio Mishima](/wiki/Yukio_Mishima "Yukio Mishima"), Japanese writer, in [Shinjuku](/wiki/Shinjuku "Shinjuku"), Tokyo, Japan (d. 1970)

**Died:** [Camille Decoppet](/wiki/Camille_Decoppet "Camille Decoppet"), 62, Swiss Federal Councilor; [Harry Furniss](/wiki/Harry_Furniss "Harry Furniss"), 80, English cartoonist, illustrator and animation pioneer
[Hans Luther](/wiki/Hans_Luther "Hans Luther") became [Chancellor of Germany](/wiki/Chancellor_of_Germany "Chancellor of Germany").

Soviet leader [Joseph Stalin](/wiki/Joseph_Stalin "Joseph Stalin") fired [Leon Trotsky](/wiki/Leon_Trotsky "Leon Trotsky") as [Commisar for Military and Naval Affairs](/wiki/Minister_of_Defence_(Soviet_Union) "Minister of Defence (Soviet Union)"). He was replaced by [Mikhail Frunze](/wiki/Mikhail_Frunze "Mikhail Frunze").
sources: Mercer, Derrik (1989). *Chronicle of the 20th Century*. London: Chronicle Communications Ltd. p. 326. [ISBN](/wiki/ISBN_(identifier) "ISBN (identifier)") [978-0-582-03919-3](/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-582-03919-3 "Special:BookSources/978-0-582-03919-3").

content: Blues artist Huddie Ledbetter, more popularly known as [Lead Belly](/wiki/Lead_Belly "Lead Belly"), was granted a full pardon by Texas governor [Pat Morris Neff](/wiki/Pat_Morris_Neff "Pat Morris Neff"), having served the minimum seven years of his prison sentence after killing one of his own relatives in a fight over a woman. Neff had been impressed by a religiously-themed song about forgiveness that Lead Belly had written and performed for him during a visit he made to the prison the previous year.
sources: Cray, Ed (2004). [*Ramblin' Man: The Life and Times of Woody Guthrie*](https://archive.org/details/ramblinman00edcr). New York: W.W. Norton & Company. p. [192](https://archive.org/details/ramblinman00edcr/page/192). [ISBN](/wiki/ISBN_(identifier) "ISBN (identifier)") [0-393-32736-1](/wiki/Special:BookSources/0-393-32736-1 "Special:BookSources/0-393-32736-1").

content: Italy passed a new electoral bill containing a controversial provision for "plural voting". Double votes were to be given to academians, professors, those with diplomas, knights, military officers, those with any military decorations, officeholders, certain business personnel, all those paying a direct tax of 100 lira or more, and fathers of at least five children. Triple votes were to be given to members of the royal family, members of high nobility, cardinals, highly decorated war veterans, high officeholders, or anyone who met three conditions for double votes. The opposition blasted the provision as disproportionately favouring the wealthy, but [Mussolini](/wiki/Benito_Mussolini "Benito Mussolini") contended that it would help to encourage educated and productive Italians.
sources: Clayton, John (January 10, 1925). "Mussolini Law to Cut Italian Workers' Vote". *[Chicago Daily Tribune](/wiki/Chicago_Daily_Tribune "Chicago Daily Tribune")*. p. 4.
Skene, Don (January 18, 1925). "Mussolini Lets Chamber Change Election Bill". *[Chicago Daily Tribune](/wiki/Chicago_Daily_Tribune "Chicago Daily Tribune")*: 19.

content: **Died:** [Aleksey Kuropatkin](/wiki/Aleksey_Kuropatkin "Aleksey Kuropatkin"), 76, Russian general and Imperial Russian Minister of War
[Miriam A. Ferguson](/wiki/Miriam_A._Ferguson "Miriam A. Ferguson") became the first female governor of [Texas](/wiki/Texas "Texas") and the second in United States history.

Italy's [Chamber of Deputies](/wiki/Chamber_of_Deputies_(Italy) "Chamber of Deputies (Italy)") repealed the "plural voting" provision in the electoral bill passed the previous day. Mussolini consented to the change upon the advice of labour leaders within his party who feared it would draw too much resentment from the working class.
sources: Skene, Don (January 18, 1925). "Mussolini Lets Chamber Change Election Bill". *[Chicago Daily Tribune](/wiki/Chicago_Daily_Tribune "Chicago Daily Tribune")*: 19.

content: **Born:** [Duane Hanson](/wiki/Duane_Hanson "Duane Hanson"), sculptor, in Alexandria, [Minnesota](/wiki/Minnesota "Minnesota") (d. 1996)

"The Gentleman Bandit" [Gerald Chapman](/wiki/Gerald_Chapman "Gerald Chapman") was apprehended on a street in [Muncie, Indiana](/wiki/Muncie,_Indiana "Muncie, Indiana"). On his person he had $5,000 cash, $3,000 in bonds, $500 worth of jewelry, a pint of [nitroglycerin](/wiki/Nitroglycerin "Nitroglycerin"), burglary tools and part of a sawed-through padlock.
sources: "Muncie Police Snare Chapman, King of Crooks". *[Chicago Daily Tribune](/wiki/Chicago_Daily_Tribune "Chicago Daily Tribune")*. January 19, 1925. p. 16.

content: **Born:** [Gilles Deleuze](/wiki/Gilles_Deleuze "Gilles Deleuze"), philosopher, in Paris (d. 1995)
The [League of Nations](/wiki/League_of_Nations "League of Nations") opened the second session of the Second Opium Conference with the goal of reducing the worldwide trafficking and use of opium.
sources: ["Chronology 1925"](https://web.archive.org/web/20200402163002/http://www.indiana.edu/~league/1925.htm). *indiana.edu*. 2002. Archived from [the original](http://www.indiana.edu/~league/1925.htm) on April 2, 2020. Retrieved January 2, 2015.

content: German Chancellor [Hans Luther](/wiki/Hans_Luther "Hans Luther") and President [Paul Löbe](/wiki/Paul_L%C3%B6be "Paul Löbe") were mercilessly heckled to an unprecedented degree in the [Reichstag](/wiki/Reichstag_building "Reichstag building") as the new Cabinet was introduced and Luther outlined the new government's policies, including support for the [Dawes Plan](/wiki/Dawes_Plan "Dawes Plan"). Cries such as "traitor", "crook" and "monarchist" rang out from republican benches.
sources: [Seldes, George](/wiki/George_Seldes "George Seldes") (January 20, 1925). "Luther to Back Dawes Plan, He Tells Reichstag". *[Chicago Daily Tribune](/wiki/Chicago_Daily_Tribune "Chicago Daily Tribune")*. p. 2.

content: **Died:** [Marie Sophie of Bavaria](/wiki/Marie_Sophie_of_Bavaria "Marie Sophie of Bavaria"), 83, last [Queen consort](/wiki/Queen_consort "Queen consort") of the [Kingdom of the Two Sicilies](/wiki/Kingdom_of_the_Two_Sicilies "Kingdom of the Two Sicilies")

The [Soviet–Japanese Basic Convention](/wiki/Soviet%E2%80%93Japanese_Basic_Convention "Soviet–Japanese Basic Convention") was signed, in which Japan and the Soviet Union restored diplomatic relations and reached a number of agreements on matters that had previously been disputed between them, including that of the northern part of [Sakhalin](/wiki/Sakhalin "Sakhalin") Island, which Japan agreed to withdraw from in exchange for oil and coal concessions.
sources: ["Chronology 1925"](https://web.archive.org/web/20200402163002/http://www.indiana.edu/~league/1925.htm). *indiana.edu*. 2002. Archived from [the original](http://www.indiana.edu/~league/1925.htm) on April 2, 2020. Retrieved January 2, 2015.

content: Chancellor [Hans Luther](/wiki/Hans_Luther "Hans Luther") casually admitted in a speech to the [Reichstag](/wiki/Reichstag_building "Reichstag building") that his Cabinet had discussed changing the form of government, but had decided to remain a constitutional republic. The statement fueled charges from republicans that Luther was preparing to restore the [German monarchy](/wiki/Monarchy_of_Germany "Monarchy of Germany"), as his Cabinet included several known monarchists.
sources: [Seldes, George](/wiki/George_Seldes "George Seldes") (January 22, 1925). "Admits German Cabinet Talked Monarchy Plan". *[Chicago Daily Tribune](/wiki/Chicago_Daily_Tribune "Chicago Daily Tribune")*. p. 7.

content: The Soviet Union held mass demonstrations culminating in five minutes of silence in observation of the first anniversary of [Vladimir Lenin](/wiki/Vladimir_Lenin "Vladimir Lenin")'s death.
sources: Tumarkin, Nina (1997). *Leinin Lives!: The Lenin Cult in Soviet Russia (Second Ed.)*. Harvard University Press. p. 237. [ISBN](/wiki/ISBN_(identifier) "ISBN (identifier)") [0-674-52431-4](/wiki/Special:BookSources/0-674-52431-4 "Special:BookSources/0-674-52431-4").

content: **Born:** [Charles Aidman](/wiki/Charles_Aidman "Charles Aidman"), actor, in [Frankfort, Indiana](/wiki/Frankfort,_Indiana "Frankfort, Indiana") (d. 1993); [Arnold Skaaland](/wiki/Arnold_Skaaland "Arnold Skaaland"), professional wrestler and manager, in [White Plains](/wiki/White_Plains,_New_York "White Plains, New York"), New York (d. 2007)

A radio [telegram](/wiki/Telegram "Telegram") was sent out through the [U.S. Army Signal Corps](/wiki/Signal_Corps_(United_States_Army) "Signal Corps (United States Army)") by Curtis Welch, the only doctor in [Nome, Alaska](/wiki/Nome,_Alaska "Nome, Alaska"), alerting all major towns in Alaska of an impending outbreak of [diphtheria](/wiki/Diphtheria "Diphtheria"). Another was sent to the [U.S. Public Health Service](/wiki/United_States_Public_Health_Service "United States Public Health Service") in Washington, D.C. explaining the desperate need for [antitoxin](/wiki/Antitoxin "Antitoxin").
sources: Aversano, Earl J. ["The 1925 Serum Run to Nome – A Synopsis"](http://www.baltostruestory.net/serumrunsynopsis.htm). *Balto's True Story*. Retrieved January 2, 2015.

content: The [Richard Eichberg](/wiki/Richard_Eichberg "Richard Eichberg")-directed German romance film *[The Motorist Bride](/wiki/The_Motorist_Bride "The Motorist Bride")* was released.
**Born:** [Katherine MacLean](/wiki/Katherine_MacLean "Katherine MacLean"), American science fiction author (d. 2019)
**Died:** [Fanny Bullock Workman](/wiki/Fanny_Bullock_Workman "Fanny Bullock Workman"), 66, American adventurer
A [coup d'état](/wiki/1925_Chilean_coup_d%27%C3%A9tat "1925 Chilean coup d'état") in Chile overthrew the [September Junta](/wiki/Government_Junta_of_Chile_(1924) "Government Junta of Chile (1924)").
**Born:** [Danny Arnold](/wiki/Danny_Arnold "Danny Arnold"), actor and television writer-producer, in New York City (d. 1995)

[Chicago Outfit](/wiki/Chicago_Outfit "Chicago Outfit") gangster [Johnny Torrio](/wiki/Johnny_Torrio "Johnny Torrio") survived an assassination attempt when [Hymie Weiss](/wiki/Hymie_Weiss "Hymie Weiss") and [Bugs Moran](/wiki/Bugs_Moran "Bugs Moran") jumped him as he and his wife were returning to their apartment from a shopping trip. Torrio was shot multiple times, but Moran's gun clicked empty when he tried to deliver a [coup de grâce](/wiki/Coup_de_gr%C3%A2ce "Coup de grâce") to Torrio's head.
sources: Tucker, Kenneth (2012). *Eliot Ness and the Untouchables* (Second ed.). Jefferson, North Carolina: McFarland & Company, Inc. pp. 49–50. [ISBN](/wiki/ISBN_(identifier) "ISBN (identifier)") [978-0-7864-4996-5](/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-7864-4996-5 "Special:BookSources/978-0-7864-4996-5").

content: A [total solar eclipse](/wiki/Solar_eclipse_of_January_24,_1925 "Solar eclipse of January 24, 1925") occurred.
**Born:** [Gus Mortson](/wiki/Gus_Mortson "Gus Mortson"), hockey player, in [New Liskeard, Ontario](/wiki/Temiskaming_Shores "Temiskaming Shores"), Canada (d. 2015)

The [tomb of Tutankhamun](/wiki/KV62 "KV62") was reopened in Egypt so [Howard Carter](/wiki/Howard_Carter "Howard Carter") could resume his archaeological work. Carter was disappointed to find that the [pall](/wiki/Pall_(funeral) "Pall (funeral)") which had covered the [sarcophagus](/wiki/Sarcophagus "Sarcophagus") was now ruined because someone in Egypt's antiquities department had carelessly stored it in a wooden shed that did not provide adequate protection from sunlight.
sources: Carter, Howard (2010). *The Tomb of Tut-Ankh-Amen, Volume II*. Cambridge University Press. p. xviii. [ISBN](/wiki/ISBN_(identifier) "ISBN (identifier)") [978-1-108-01815-9](/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-1-108-01815-9 "Special:BookSources/978-1-108-01815-9").
Parker, A. Stanley (January 26, 1925). "Sun Destroys 3,000 Yr. Old Pall of Tut". *[Chicago Daily Tribune](/wiki/Chicago_Daily_Tribune "Chicago Daily Tribune")*. p. 1.

content: **Died:** [Alexander Kaulbars](/wiki/Alexander_Kaulbars "Alexander Kaulbars"), 80, Russian general and explorer

300,000 units of [antitoxin](/wiki/Antitoxin "Antitoxin") were located in [Anchorage](/wiki/Anchorage,_Alaska "Anchorage, Alaska"), enough to contain the Alaskan [diphtheria](/wiki/Diphtheria "Diphtheria") epidemic temporarily.
sources: Aversano, Earl J. ["The 1925 Serum Run to Nome – A Synopsis"](http://www.baltostruestory.net/serumrunsynopsis.htm). *Balto's True Story*. Retrieved January 2, 2015.

content: **Born:** [Joan Leslie](/wiki/Joan_Leslie "Joan Leslie"), actress and dancer, in [Detroit](/wiki/Detroit "Detroit") (d. 2015); [Paul Newman](/wiki/Paul_Newman "Paul Newman"), actor, entrepreneur and activist, in [Shaker Heights, Ohio](/wiki/Shaker_Heights,_Ohio "Shaker Heights, Ohio") (d. 2008)

**Died:** [Caspar F. Goodrich](/wiki/Caspar_F._Goodrich "Caspar F. Goodrich"), 78, American admiral; [Sir James Mackenzie](/wiki/James_Mackenzie_(cardiologist) "James Mackenzie (cardiologist)"), 71, Scottish cardiologist

The [January Junta](/wiki/Government_Junta_of_Chile_(1925) "Government Junta of Chile (1925)") was established to restore [Arturo Alessandri](/wiki/Arturo_Alessandri "Arturo Alessandri") to power in Chile.

A number of injuries were reported in Berlin as rioting broke out among monarchists, communists and republicans during demonstrations held on the birthday of former ex-kaiser [Wilhelm II](/wiki/Wilhelm_II,_German_Emperor "Wilhelm II, German Emperor").
sources: [Seldes, George](/wiki/George_Seldes "George Seldes") (January 28, 1925). "Many Injured in Kaiser Birthday Riot in Berlin". *[Chicago Daily Tribune](/wiki/Chicago_Daily_Tribune "Chicago Daily Tribune")*. p. 13.

content: Alaskan Territorial Governor [Scott Cordelle Bone](/wiki/Scott_Cordelle_Bone "Scott Cordelle Bone") gave the final authorization for a succession of [dog sled](/wiki/Dog_sled "Dog sled") teams to deliver the [antitoxin](/wiki/Antitoxin "Antitoxin") to [Nome](/wiki/Nome,_Alaska "Nome, Alaska") to relieve the [diphtheria](/wiki/Diphtheria "Diphtheria") epidemic, beginning the relay that would become known as the [1925 serum run to Nome](/wiki/1925_serum_run_to_Nome "1925 serum run to Nome").
sources: Aversano, Earl J. ["The 1925 Serum Run to Nome – A Synopsis (Page 2)"](http://www.baltostruestory.net/serumrunsynopsisp2.htm). *Balto's True Story*. Retrieved January 2, 2015.

content: A contingent of Russian mercenaries working for the [Fengtian clique](/wiki/Fengtian_clique "Fengtian clique") captured [Shanghai](/wiki/Shanghai "Shanghai") with no resistance.
sources: Rigby, Richard (March 14, 2014). "Sapajou's Shanghai". *China Heritage Quarterly*. China Heritage Project.
Powell, John (January 29, 1925). "Shanghai 'Falls' Before Company of Mercenaries". *[Chicago Daily Tribune](/wiki/Chicago_Daily_Tribune "Chicago Daily Tribune")*. p. 6.

content: Actress [Gloria Swanson](/wiki/Gloria_Swanson "Gloria Swanson") married the French nobleman [Henry de La Falaise](/wiki/Henry_de_La_Falaise "Henry de La Falaise") in Paris.

20 were killed and 20 wounded in [Shanghai](/wiki/Shanghai "Shanghai") when representatives of the [Fengtian Clique](/wiki/Fengtian_Clique "Fengtian Clique") met resistance attempting to disarm about 1,000 defeated [Jiangsu](/wiki/Jiangsu "Jiangsu") troops.
sources: "20 Die, 20 Hurt in Panic During Shanghai Fight". *[Chicago Daily Tribune](/wiki/Chicago_Daily_Tribune "Chicago Daily Tribune")*. January 30, 1925. p. 5.

content: **Born:** [Robert W. McCollum](/wiki/Robert_W._McCollum "Robert W. McCollum"), virologist and epidemiologist, in [Waco, Texas](/wiki/Waco,_Texas "Waco, Texas") (d. 2010)

Turkish authorities exiled the [Ecumenical Patriarch of Constantinople](/wiki/Ecumenical_Patriarch_of_Constantinople "Ecumenical Patriarch of Constantinople") [Constantine VI](/wiki/Constantine_VI_of_Constantinople "Constantine VI of Constantinople") to Greece, to strong objections from the Greek public.
sources: Kamousis, Dimitris (2014). "Incorporating the Ecumenical Patriarchate into Modern Turkey: The Legacy of the 1924 Patriarchal Election". In Lytra, Vally (ed.). *When Greeks and Turks Meet: Interdisciplinary Perspectives on the Relationship Since 1923* (ebook ed.). [Burlington, Vermont](/wiki/Burlington,_Vermont "Burlington, Vermont"): [Ashgate Publishing Company](/wiki/Ashgate_Publishing_Company "Ashgate Publishing Company"). p. 236.

content: The [Owencarrow Viaduct Disaster](/wiki/Londonderry_and_Lough_Swilly_Railway#Owencarrow_Viaduct_disaster "Londonderry and Lough Swilly Railway") killed four when high winds blew a train off a viaduct in [County Donegal](/wiki/County_Donegal "County Donegal"), Ireland.

The [dog sled](/wiki/Dog_sled "Dog sled") team of [Leonhard Seppala](/wiki/Leonhard_Seppala "Leonhard Seppala") with lead dog [Togo](/wiki/Togo_(dog) "Togo (dog)") ran the longest and most perilous leg of the [serum run](/wiki/1925_serum_run_to_Nome "1925 serum run to Nome"), through the dark across the dangerous ice of [Norton Sound](/wiki/Norton_Sound "Norton Sound").
sources: Aversano, Earl J. ["The 1925 Serum Run to Nome – A Synopsis (Page 3)"](http://www.baltostruestory.net/serumrunsynopsisp3.htm). *Balto's True Story*. Retrieved January 2, 2015.

content: **Died:** [George Washington Cable](/wiki/George_Washington_Cable "George Washington Cable"), 80, American novelist
